column4: ok. i'm confused.  i know ubuntu is gnome based, but i installed kde.  is there a reason that would mess with sshd and proftpd?
no
and ubuntu is debian based, using the gnome window manager, among others :)
that's what i meant.
so what is sshd doing (or not) :}
failing before connection attempt.  may have something to do with xinetd.
maybe - log messages?
sshd is usually rock solid
it's not being run by xinetd, but inetd has thrown a huge number of errors.
oic :(
either way. i can't find error messages from either sshd or proftpd.  both init scripts print "Starting service   [fail] "
possible problem in the conf file - it sounds like to me
you trying anything fancy?
except they were working fine yesterday and i haven't changed anything.
nothing fancy.  sshd is allowing a user with a local account to login remotely, proftpd is sharing a couple of files, both only for my home network.
i dunno then.  the fact that both are screwing up is a clue
i am having problems coming up with the common thing
i'll try removing xinetd from the runlevel and rebooting.  that's the last thing i changed.
pls let me know
will do.
uhh. removing xinetd didn't work.
